snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s revival of a plan for a Metro-North spur serving Co-op City, in the northeast Bronx, would put Midtown just a half-hour away.
abstract: Appraisal column notes that New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo’s revival of a plan for a Metro-North spur serving Co-op City in the northeast Bronx, would put Midtown just a half-hour away for residents; plan could also start a transformation in Co-op City, nation's largest subsidized housing cooperative, which remains a safe, leafy place where a three-bedroom co-op costs $27,000 to buy and less than $1,500 a month in maintenance fees.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s revival of a plan for a Metro-North spur serving Co-op City, in the northeast Bronx, would put Midtown just a half-hour away.

headline.print_headline: Proposed Metro-North Link Could Wake Up Sleepy Co-op City
headline.main: Proposed Metro-North Link Could Wake Up Sleepy Co-op City
